Home and Pro editions of Windows 11, version 22H2 are at end of service today, October 8, 2024. They will no longer receive any updates. To continue receiving security and non-security updates after October 8, 2024, we recommend that you update to the latest version of Windows. 
Note

Windows 11, version 22H2 
This security update includes improvements that were a part of update  
KB5043145 
(released September 26, 2024). Below is a summary of the key issues that this update addresses when you install this KB. If there are new features, it lists them as well. The bold text within the brackets indicates the item or area of the change we are documenting. 
[Multiple restarts (known issue)] 
 Fixed: Your device might restart multiple times or stop responding. Blue or green screens also appear. In some cases, the Automatic Repair tool opens by itself. In other cases, the issue triggers  
BitLocker recovery 
. 
If you installed earlier updates, only the new updates contained in this package will be downloaded and installed on your device. 
For more information about security vulnerabilities, please refer to the  
Security Update Guide 
 website and the  
October 2024 Security Updates 
. 
Windows 11 servicing stack update (KB5046247) - 22621.4312 and 22631.4312 
This update makes quality improvements to the servicing stack, which is the component that installs Windows updates. Servicing stack updates (SSU) ensure that you have a robust and reliable servicing stack so that your devices can receive and install Microsoft updates.

Microsoft is not currently aware of any issues with this update.​​​​​​​

summary:
KB5044285 is a cumulative security update released on October 8, 2024, targeting Windows 11 versions 22H2 (OS Builds 22621.4317) and 23H2 (OS Builds 22631.4317). This update addresses security vulnerabilities including known issues with multiple device restarts and BitLocker recovery triggers. Administrators are advised that Home and Pro editions of version 22H2 have reached end of service and will no longer receive updates, while Enterprise and Education editions will continue to be supported. Installation of this update can be achieved through Windows Update, Windows Update for Business, or WSUS, with no additional prerequisites necessary.

**Technical Breakdown**

**Vulnerabilities and Exploits**:
- This update addresses multiple high-impact vulnerabilities related to device restarts leading to unresponsive states or BitLocker recovery prompts, stemming from prior updates, specifically KB5043145.

**Known Issues**:
- Multiple Restarts (Known Issue)
  - Impact: Devices may restart multiple times or halt.
  - Resolution: Install KB5044285 as it addresses these issues.

**Installation Process and Prerequisites**:
- To install the update:
    - **Windows Update**: Automatically downloaded and installed.
    - **Windows Update for Business**: Automatically downloaded based on configured policies.
    - **Standalone Installation**: Available via the Microsoft Update Catalog.
    - **WSUS**: Syncs automatically if products and classifications are configured:
      ```
      [WSUS Configuration]
      Product: Windows 11
      Classification: Security Updates
      ```
- To remove LCU after installation, use:
    ```
    [Powershell]
    ```powershell
    DISM /online /get-packages
    DISM /remove-package /packagename:<PackageName>
    ``` 
    - Note: Running `wusa.exe /uninstall` will not work due to the combined SSU.
